topic.title: Device Datapaths

body.p: End to end datapaths through the device are configured using a collection of API calls that provision datapath segments. A datapath segment defines a portion of an end to end datapath between intermediate connection points such as a SerDes port and the DCPB. The purpose of this section is to provide example datapaths for device applications that are listed in the device product overview 1 , identify the datapath segment endpoints (including the endpoints signal types), and introduce the APIs that provision each datapath segment. Refer to section Application Level Identifiers for a description of the identifiers used to specify the datapath segment provisioning API endpoints.

The operating mode of a datapath is defined by the parameters to the datapath segment provisioning APIs. Additional detail on the arguments associated with the segment provisioning APIs are provided in the subsystem sections. The subsystem sections include information on APIs for configuring runtime operations on provisioned entities. Examples of runtime operations are configuring management information for atomic functions such as the transmit trail trace identifiers for trail termination source functions or disabling a consequential action that is enabled by default when a function is provisioned. Debug and diagnostic features along with their associated APIs or utilities are also described in the subsystem sections.
